channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- CPG BIOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- CPG BIOS

item.title: CVE-2022-32488|2024-08-03T07:39:51.115Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-26860|2024-08-03T05:18:38.162Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input via SMI to bypass security checks resulting in arbitrary code execution in SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24421|2024-08-03T04:13:55.648Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24418|2024-08-03T04:13:55.599Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32492|2024-08-03T07:46:43.419Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-29083|2024-08-03T06:10:59.032Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Prior Dell BIOS versions contain an Improper Authentication vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by bypassing drive security mechanisms in order to gain access to the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-31225|2024-08-03T07:11:39.911Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Unchecked Return Value vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to change the state of the system or cause unexpected failures.

item.title: CVE-2022-22567|2024-08-03T03:14:55.853Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Select Dell Client Commercial and Consumer platforms are vulnerable to an insufficient verification of data authenticity vulnerability. An authenticated malicious user may exploit this vulnerability in order to install modified BIOS firmware.

item.title: CVE-2022-26861|2024-08-03T05:18:37.970Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Insecure Automated Optimization vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input via SMI to obtain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32484|2024-08-03T07:39:51.232Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to modify a UEFI variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-22566|2024-08-03T03:14:55.765Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Select Dell Client Commercial and Consumer platforms contain a pre-boot direct memory access (DMA) vulnerability. An authenticated attacker with physical access to the system may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to execute arbitrary code on the device.

item.title: CVE-2022-31224|2024-08-03T07:11:39.886Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Improper Protection Against Voltage and Clock Glitches vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by triggering a fault condition in order to change the behavior of the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-31220|2024-08-03T07:11:39.887Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Unchecked Return Value vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to change the state of the system or cause unexpected failures.

item.title: CVE-2022-32491|2024-08-03T07:39:51.191Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client BIOS contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by manipulating an SMI to cause an arbitrary write during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32482|2024-08-03T07:39:51.051Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to modify a UEFI variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-26858|2024-08-03T05:18:37.924Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Improper Authentication vulnerability. A locally authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input to an SMI in order to bypass security controls.

item.title: CVE-2022-26859|2024-08-03T05:18:37.781Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains a race condition vulnerability. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input via SMI in order to bypass security checks during SMM.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.description: Prior Dell BIOS versions contain an Input Validation vulnerability. A locally authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input to an SMI in order to bypass security controls in SMM.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24410|2024-08-03T04:13:55.264Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an information exposure vulnerability. An unauthenticated local attacker with physical access to the system and knowledge of the system configuration could potentially exploit this vulnerability to read system information via debug interfaces.

item.title: CVE-2022-32485|2024-08-03T07:39:51.090Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-31221|2024-08-03T07:11:39.909Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Information Exposure vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability in order access sensitive state information on the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-32483|2024-08-03T07:39:51.229Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to modify a UEFI variable.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-31226|2024-08-03T07:11:39.865Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain a Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending excess data to a function in order to gain arbitrary code execution on the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-31222|2024-08-03T07:11:39.978Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain a Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by consuming excess memory in order to cause the application to crash.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Improper Neutralization of Null Byte vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending unexpected null bytes in order to read memory on the system.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains a Signed to Unsigned Conversion Error vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Platform BIOS contains an Improper Null Termination vulnerability. A high privilege user with network access to the system could potentially send malicious data to the device in order to cause some services to cease to function.
